attributes.title: Stock Take
attributes.description:
•    Physical stock counted compared to SAP warehouse balances indicated variances as follows; Bread had -17.25 loaves, Utto had +6.8Ltrs,   Polybags had +728 pieces, While crates had -7 Pieces. The rest of the stock items had zero variances.

The table illustrates the finding;
attributes.recommendation:
•    Stock controls in place should be maintained to safeguard all stock items.
•    Adjustment of utto consumption BOM to align with the actual consumption.
attributes.effect: •    Minimal stock variations is indication of adequate controls in place, improvement needed on the few variances noted.

value: •    We shall maintain stock controls to safeguard against any loss.
•    Control measures shall be put in place.

•    In prior audit, The following were the stock findings;
    Bread -     -86 loaves
    Cumulative variance in polybags was -133 pieces
    All other materials had negligible variances.

•    Stock take was conducted on 25th April 2025 to establish whether the physical stocks were matching with the stock book balance generated from SAP system and whether internal controls on stocks were effective.
Most stock items are well controlled. Improvement is required to eliminate all stocks variances in future.
Operations/Production Department
To evaluate stock controls in place for effectiveness.

attributes.title: Bread Weight
attributes.description: From the samples picked, bread underweight were noted across all varieties as illustrated below.
attributes.recommendation: •    Underweight cases should be discouraged. The production team should ensure that standard production procedures are adhered to at all stages.
attributes.effect: The company is at risk of regulatory penalties if underweight bread is identified by Weights and Measures officials in the market

value: •    We will continue to do random checks on bread production process to ensure we produce bread within the recommended weight standards.
•    We have introduced tags for proper follow up per shift on quality of bread produced.

•    In prior audit, underweight bread were as follows; 400g CT - 2.67%, 600g CT – 10.67%,
800g CT – 6.67%,

Bread weight check was done from a sample selected from packed bread ready to be dispatched to the market. The aim was to establish whether the bread dispatched to the market meets the required weight standards.
Underweight cases were noted across all varieties sampled. The branch management should ensure that all standard operating procedures are observed to eliminate cases of bread underweight.
Operations/Production Department
To verify that all finished products meet the minimum weight requirement before being dispatched to the market

attributes.title: Bread Damages
attributes.description:
Bread Damages percentages

•    It was noted that production damages were averaging at 0.20% of the total production and market damages stood at 0.12% of the total sales. 

Production & Market damages analysis;

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Bread damages physical verification

•    From the analysis, it was noted that there were 1,218.35 kgs of damages equivalent to 3,045.88 loaves, sent to ingredients and had not been recorded in the manager’s damages record;
attributes.recommendation:
•    The management should ensure damages are maintained at the desired levels.

•    The branch management should ensure there is full disclosure and accountability of damages in the branch.
attributes.effect: •    Significant variation of bread damages recorded against damages sent to ingredient implies lack of proper damages accountability.

value: •    We have been trying to ensure there is accountability on damages, actions have been taken and this shall be improved going forward

•    Great improvement compared to last month. Introduction of tags in the branch we expected to have better results.

•    We have put a system in place and informed the supervisors and Manager to be accountable.
•    In the prior audit, it was noted that physical bread damages had a variance of +13 kg (32.5 loaves).

•    Analysis of production and market damages was done for a period of 30 days from 26th Mar 2025 to 24th April 2025 to determine whether production and market damages were within the desired percentages of 0.20% of the total production and 0.50% of the total sales respectively.
Bread damages percentages are within the desired level whereas physical damage controls are wanting.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure that damages are controlled.

attributes.title: Mixing Charts Analysis
attributes.description:
•    Below is a summary of SAP production data compared to physical mixing data collected;

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

•    It was noted that, Average production was 157.97 bags per day, which is 75% of the daily target of 210 bags. Yield achieved during the period was 191.74.

•    The table below shows summarized findings of the mixing chart production analysis.
attributes.recommendation: •    Branch should continue to adhere with production standards and also take advantage of the available production capacity.
attributes.effect: There exist an idle production capacity of 25%

value: •    We plan production as per orders hence the target shortfall
•    We have informed the team to be vigilant during production processes.

•    In the previous audit, there was no significant variance between system and the actual material consumption.
•    Correct posting was also noted over the audited period

•    An analysis of mixing chart summaries was done for a period of 30 days from 26th Mar 2025 to 24th April 2025, to confirm production data accuracy from mixing charts to cash flow and SAP, raw materials usage as per the set BOM, production yield and if the set production standards were achieved.
Mixing data from physical mixing charts to the system was found to be accurate. Branch capacity utilization was at 75%
Operations/Production Department
Confirm data accuracy, average production and adherence to branch production parameters as far as raw material consumption is concerned..

attributes.title: Cash Count
attributes.description:
•    Cash counted compared to cash flow balance had a nil variance 
•    There were two pending IOU’s amounting to Kes. 12,900 as illustrated below
attributes.recommendation: •    The branch cashier should maintain the cash controls in place

value: •    This is well noted
•    Well maintained.
•    In the previous audit, Minimal variances were noted during spot-check.
•    Verification of cash held at the cash office on 27th April 2025, to confirm cash held by the cashier matches the expected cash and whether the set cash operation standards are adhered to.
The cash office is well maintained as evidenced by the nil variances
Operations/Production Department
To ensure there are strong controls in company cash handling

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check
attributes.description: •    Mini shop bread balance and sales proceed were properly accounted as illustrated below;
attributes.recommendation: •    The controls in place at the mini shop were found to be adequate and are operating effectively. It is recommended that these controls be maintained to ensure continued compliance and operational efficiency.
attributes.effect: •    The operations were carried out in accordance with the established standards

value: •    This is well noted. We shall maintain the controls.
•    We will maintain.
•    The shop attendant accounted for all the bread loaded.
•    A spot check was conducted in the mini shop on 12th April 2025 to assess whether the operation were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.
The laid down SOPs are adhered to
Sales Department
To ensure there is accountability at the mini shop and that all SOPs are adhered to.

attributes.title: Debtors Analysis
attributes.description:
•    It was noted that, the total outstanding debtors amounted to Kshs 959,786. Outstanding balances relating to Institution amounted to Kshs 820,750. representing 85% of the total debtors. Outstanding balances involving ex-staff misappropriation amounted to Kshs. 108,823.50

Outstanding debtors schedule;
attributes.recommendation:
•    Branch management to ensure that bread supplied is paid for on delivery for customers without credit arrangement.
•    Follow up on ex-staff who misappropriated company cash should be expedited.
attributes.effect: •    Outstanding route balances for customers without a credit arrangement may result in bad debts, leading to potential financial losses.

value: •    Debts involving ex-staff are known by the management.
•    No supply is done without payment. The debtors outstanding are well known.
•    An analysis of the route balances was done as at 25th April 2025 to ascertain the status thereof.
The outstanding debtors exposes the company to a possible financial loss incase of default
Sales Department
To assess the extent of exposure through outstanding balances.

attributes.title: Production efficiency
attributes.description:
•    It was noted that the production efficiency for the period was 4.43 bags per production worker. 

A summary of production analysis is shown below;
attributes.recommendation: •    The controls in place on production workers should be enhanced to eliminate the inefficiency noted.
attributes.effect: •    Efficiency shortfall implies that the company spent unbudgeted production costs amounting to Kshs. 21,237.33

value: •    We shall ensure we continue to manage our workers efficiently.
•    Great improvement compared to last month.
•    In the prior audit, production efficiency was at 4.32 bags per production worker

•    Production efficiency was calculated for period of 30 days from 26th Mar 2025 to 24th April 2025. The aim was to determine if the production workers hired were achieving the set production efficiency of 4.5 bags per worker.
The branch production workers missed efficiency slightly. The branch should improve on how they manage the workers to eliminate the slight inefficiency noted.
Operations/Production Department
To assess how hired production workers are managed.

attributes.title: Packing Efficiency
attributes.description:
•    Analysis revealed that the average slicing efficiency for the period was 96.63 crates per slicer. 

The table below illustrates the findings;-
attributes.recommendation: •    Branch management should ensure packers hired are well controlled to maintain the efficiency.
attributes.effect: •    The efficiency achieved implies that packing workers were managed well during this period.

value: •    We are closely continue to monitor our slicers to ensure the efficiency is maintained.
•    Proper system is in place. We will make sure the set standard is achieve.
•    In the prior audit, packing efficiency was at 95.78 crates per slicer.
•    Slicing efficiency was calculated over a 30-day period, from 26th March 2025, to 24th April 2025, to determine whether the KPI of 97 crates per slicer was being met.
The efficiency achieved was within the company standard
Operations/Production Department
To assess how slicers are managed and the cost thereof.

attributes.title: Vehicle Fuel Consumption
attributes.description:
•    It was noted that all branch motor vehicles were consuming as per the set standards with minimal variations.
•    Mileage analysis illustration table is annexed below.
attributes.recommendation: •    Fuel consumption controls should be maintained
attributes.effect: •    Minimal variations is an indication of efficient fuel management.

value: •    This shall be maintained.
•    To be maintained.
•    In the prior audit, Fuel consumption analysis showed that all sales vans fuel consumption was within the expected range.
•    Motor vehicle fuel consumption analysis was done for the period 1st April 2025 to 25th April 2025, to evaluate compliance with set fuel standard for each vehicle.
Motor vehicle consumption is adequately controlled.
Transport/Fleet Department
To assess branch fuel consumption with the set standards.
